page.title: 02OSWESTRY WATER WORKS.
page.content:
THE WATER WORKS IN OSWESTRY IS A TYPICAL EXAMPLE OF A WATER SUPPLY SYSTEM.IT WAS BUILT IN 1890 AND COVERS AN AREA OF 57 ACRES .40 PEOPLE ARE EMPLOYED THERE.THE WORKS IS FED WITH WATER FROM LAKE VYRNWY AND APPROX 57*10^6 GALLONS PER WEEK PASS THROUGH. THE AREA IT SERVES IS WIDE SPREAD:SEVERN TRENT, CHESHIRE, MALPAS, RUNCORN, WARRINGTON, ST. HELENS, WIDNESS AND LIVERPOOL.
A VARIETY OF CHEMICALS ARE USED TO PURIFY THE WATER. COMPLAINTS FROM THE PUBLIC ARE SOMETIMES REGISTERED, SPECIFYING THAT COLOUR AND TASTE ARE NOT QUITE WHAT THEY SHOULD BE. OFTEN ACCIDENTS OCCUR _ MAIN PIPES MAY BURST.THESE PIPES ARE 42 INCHES IN DIAMETER.
